H0.text: What Canadian city was named by explorer Jacques Cartier, meaning originally 'Royal Mount'. Quebec City

H1.text: What Canadian city was named by explorer Jacques Cartier, meaning originally 'Royal Mount'. Trois-Rivières

H2.text: What Canadian city was named by explorer Jacques Cartier, meaning originally 'Royal Mount'. Montreal's neighboring city, Laval

H3.text: What Canadian city was named by explorer Jacques Cartier, meaning originally 'Royal Mount'. Montrea

A4.text: The current form of the name, Montréal, is generally thought to be derived from Mount Royal (Mont Royal in French), the triple-peaked hill in the heart of the city.
